vectorData.altText: 26. Identify the class of epithelium A. Be specific.
That's right! Endothelial cells that line the blood vessels belong to the class of simple squamous epithelium.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

P1 = pneumocyte
BM = fused basement membraneE = endothelial cell
Er = erythrocyte (RBC)
thinness promotes rapid and usually passive molecular transport; e.g. alveoli, endothelium, mesothelia

Pleural, pericardial and peritoneal cavities are lined by mesothelia.
Mesothelia, combined with its underlying connective tissue, forms serous membranes (pleura, pericardium, peritoneum) that secrete serous fluid into the body cavity.
Serous fluid (pleural fluid, pericardial fluid, peritoneal fluid) acts as a lubricant that facilitates the movement of the organs within the body cavity.
